page.title: 02EAST MERSEA'S DEMOGRAPHY
page.content: East Mersea had a population of 273 in 1981 which was only one more than in 1971. There are slightly more males than females(141m/132f) which is different to the national ratio. Almost 25% of the population are over 65 which is above the national average but surprisingly the number of children (62) is about the national average. One-third of households have children and 40% have at least one pensioner. This suggests that East Mersea is popular for both retirement and families. Only 8.8% of the economically active population are unemployed but a very high 25% are self employed.A survey of households revealed 56% worked on Mersea Island, 25% in Colchester and about 10% in London.These results reflect the large number of self-employed and employment in farming.
